title: Explain this to a 5 year old
selftext:
The Budget 2023 has hiked the basic exemption limit to Rs 3 lakh from Rs 2.5 lakh currently. Thus, an individual's income becomes taxable if it exceeds Rs 3 lakh in a financial year. However, to reiterate, no tax has to be paid if the taxable income does not exceed Rs 7 lakh under the new tax regime.  


Read more at:  
[https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/wealth/tax/who-is-eligible-for-tax-rebate-under-section-87a-of-the-income-tax-act/articleshow/97574684.cms?utm\_source=contentofinterest&utm\_medium=text&utm\_campaign=cppst](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/wealth/tax/who-is-eligible-for-tax-rebate-under-section-87a-of-the-income-tax-act/articleshow/97574684.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=cppst)

I'm too dumb for this. Like you're telling me no tax for up to 7 lakhs but in tax slabs rates starts from 3 lakhs. Someone please enlighten my ooga booga peanut of a brain :)
comments:
Total Income = 7,00,000

Basic exemption = 3,00,000

Taxable income = Total income - Basic exemption = 4,00,000

Tax calculation

* slab 3,00,000 - 6,00,000 at 5% = 3,00,000 x 5% = 15,000
* slab 6,00,000 - 9,00,000 at 10% = 1,00,000 x 10% = 10,000

87a Rebate under new tax regime = 25,000

Net payable tax = 15,000 + 10,000 - 25,000 = Nil

87A rebate [isn't available to all taxpayers](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/wealth/tax/section-87a-income-tax-rebate-is-not-available-on-these-incomes/articleshow/102110244.cms).

The tax slabs are general rules applicable to all taxpayers.

87A rebate is a special exception available to some taxpayers.
so if my income is 3 lakhs the govt. should pay me 10,000? /s
if my income is between 6 and 7,do i have to file ITR or is it understood that i wont have to pay any tax.
